text: Juraj Kotula (born 30 September 1995) is a Slovak footballer who currently plays for FC Zbrojovka Brno. ==Club career== ===ŠK Slovan Bratislava=== Kotula made his professional Fortuna Liga's debut for ŠK Slovan Bratislava on February 27, 2015 against MŠK Žilina.SLOVAN BRATISLAVA VS. ŽILINA 0 - 2 27.02.2015, soccerway.com ==International career== Kotula was called up for two unofficial friendly fixtures held in Abu Dhabi, UAE, in January 2017, against Uganda and Sweden. He capped his debut against Uganda, being fielded for the first half, before being substituted by Martin Šulek at the start of the second half. Slovakia went on to lose the game 1–3. Kotula did not start in a 0–6 loss to Sweden later that week.http://www.sportinak.sk/online-prenos- pripravny-zapas-futbal--slovensko---ugandahttp://www.sportinak.sk/online- prenos-pripravny-zapas-futbal--slovensko---svedsko-teraz ==References== ==External links== * ŠK Slovan Bratislava profile * * Futbalnet profile Category:1995 births Category:Living people Category:Slovak footballers Category:Association football defenders Category:ŠK Slovan Bratislava players Category:FK Senica players Category:FC ViOn Zlaté Moravce players Category:FC Zbrojovka Brno players Category:Slovak Super Liga players Category:Expatriate footballers in the Czech Republic Category:Sportspeople from Bratislava Category:Slovak expatriate sportspeople in the Czech Republic Category:Czech National Football League players
title: Juraj Kotula
